p: To understand what comprises the observed similarity in wood decay, we focused on co-orthologous gene/protein pairs up- or downregulated in invasive mycelia of both species. We found 779 co-orthologs having similar differential expression in the invasive mycelium. Of these 372 and 407 were significantly up- and downregulated, respectively ( Figure 4B, Supplementary Table S5). For the 372 upregulated co-orthologs, we observed overall higher fold changes and expression levels in A. cepistipes than in A. ostoyae ( Figure 4B), again, underscoring a stronger response of A. cepistipes to wood.
